dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple and SpaceX Link Up to Support Starlink Satellite Network on iPhones
News Content: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. has been secretly working with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc. to add support for the Starlink network in its latest iPhone software, providing an alternative to the company’s in-house satellite-communication service.

Most Read from Bloomberg

Trump's Federal Funding Pause Threatens State Financials  Housing Aid Uncertain After Trump’s Spending Freeze Memo Texas HOA Charged With Discrimination for Banning Section 8 Renters Newsom Enlists Magic Johnson, Guggenheim CEO for LA Rebuilding US Students’ Reading Scores Drop to Worst in More Than 20 Years

The companies have been testing iPhones with the Starlink service from Elon Musk’s Space Exploration Technologies Corp., according to people with knowledge of the matter. In an under-the-radar move, the smartphone’s latest software update — released Monday — now supports the technology.

The tie-up comes as a surprise: T-Mobile has previously only specified Starlink as an option for Samsung Electronics Co. phones, such as the Z Fold and S24 models. Apple, meanwhile, already provides a Globalstar Inc. offering that lets consumers send texts and contact emergency responders when out of cellular range.

T-Mobile has begun allowing customers to sign up for an early version of the Starlink service, and this week the carrier enabled a small number of iPhones as part of a beta test. In a post on X responding to the news, Musk said images, music and podcasts should be supported by current Starlink technology and future upgrades will add video support as well.

The first users received text messages from T-Mobile saying, “You’re in the T-Mobile Starlink beta. You can now stay connected with texting via satellite from virtually anywhere. To start experiencing coverage beyond, please update to iOS 18.3.” Users in the program have a new toggle switch in their iPhone cellular data settings to manage the satellite feature.

An Apple spokesperson declined to comment, while T-Mobile said that the test will “begin with select optimized smartphones” and that the full launch will “support the vast majority of modern smartphones.” T-Mobile has also opened the beta to some users running Android 15, the latest version of the Google operating system. A representative for SpaceX didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.

Globalstar shares fell about 11% in premarket trading in New York on Wednesday.

Ever since Apple teamed up with Globalstar to offer satellite features in 2022, there’s been speculation over whether it might support competing networks. The day after Apple’s 2022 announcement, Musk posted on X that his company has “had some promising conversations with Apple about Starlink connectivity.”

Story Continues

Here’s how it will work: When a T-Mobile iPhone is in an area without cellular connectivity, devices that are part of the Starlink program will first try to pair with SpaceX satellites. Users will also be able to activate texting via the satellite menu for the Globalstar service or contact emergency services through Apple.

The initial version of Starlink is exclusively for texting. But SpaceX and T-Mobile have said that they plan to expand into data connections and voice calls in the future. The program also is only available in the US for now. That contrasts with Apple’s Globalstar service, which works in several countries. SpaceX is looking to expand Starlink to other carriers globally.

There’s another major difference between the two services. The current Apple feature requires users to point their iPhone to the sky to find a satellite. The Starlink option, meanwhile, is designed to work automatically — even when the phone is in a customer’s pocket.

Both the Starlink and Apple satellite features are designed to work in off-the-grid areas, such as hiking trails, that don’t have cellular service. The capabilities can’t be used in places where a mobile-phone network is within reach. Support for the Apple feature is available on most current iPhone models and the company plans to bring it to its Ultra smartwatch later this year, Bloomberg News has reported.

T-Mobile updated its website this week to tell beta testers that the iPhone is supported as part of the iOS 18.3 software release. As of now, the number of users in the beta is minimal, with T-Mobile planning to expand the program in February. Apple’s announcement of iOS 18.3 touted AI features and bug fixes, but it didn’t disclose the Starlink support.

SpaceX requested authority to begin beta-testing the service starting Monday. The Federal Communications Commission granted SpaceX conditional approval for its satellites to supplement T-Mobile’s cellular network in November.

--With assistance from Loren Grush.

(Updates with Globalstar premarket shares in the seventh paragraph)

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news of Apple's partnership with SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into iPhones could be seen positively by the market, as it represents a significant technological advancement and expansion of service offerings. This partnership may enhance Apple's competitive position in the smartphone market against other brands, especially given the novelty of automatic satellite connectivity. However, there are risks associated with this move, such as potential market share loss for Globalstar, which has already seen a decline in its stock. Overall, the positive sentiment towards innovation and expanded capabilities likely outweighs potential negatives, suggesting a higher probability of stock price rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: This news is mixed but generally positive for Apple. It introduces a new feature (Starlink connectivity) that could be attractive to users, especially in areas with poor cellular coverage, giving Apple a competitive edge. The fact that it was kept secret and then rolled out suggests a strategic move to gain an advantage. The negative aspect is the potential dilution of Apple's existing Globalstar partnership, as Globalstar's stock already fell in response. However, the expanded connectivity options, combined with future capability for data and voice , suggests long term value. Furthermore, the support for iPhones on T-Mobile Starlink Beta test can encourage and support expansion to other carriers globally. Considering these points, it's more likely than not that this news will have a positive, but not overwhelmingly positive, effect on Apple's stock price. Investors will be intrigued by the added functionality, but also cautious about the impact on the Globalstar partnership. Given the negative reaction from Globalstar, it is possible for the stock price to fall on the news as well.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news of Apple integrating Starlink satellite technology into iPhones through a partnership with SpaceX and T-Mobile is potentially positive for Apple.  This expands Apple's satellite communication capabilities beyond its existing Globalstar partnership, offering a more advanced and potentially more widely usable service (automatic connection, future data/voice capabilities).  The surprise nature of the announcement and the positive reaction from Elon Musk on X suggest a potential for increased customer interest and brand enhancement. However, the current limited beta test and geographical restrictions (US only initially)  temper the immediate impact.  The negative impact on Globalstar's stock price suggests some investors view this as a competitive threat, albeit a limited one at this stage, which may somewhat dampen enthusiasm for Apple, but likely less than the overall positive sentiment.  Therefore, a slight increase in Apple's stock price is more probable than a decrease, but the effect is expected to be modest because of the phased rollout and current limitations of Starlink integration.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple Inc. is expanding its satellite communication capabilities by partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink support into its iPhones. This move enhances Apple's competitive edge in satellite communication, potentially attracting more customers and reinforcing its ecosystem. The partnership with high-profile companies like SpaceX and T-Mobile could positively influence investor sentiment. However, the stock price of Globalstar, Apple's previous satellite partner, fell significantly, indicating potential concerns about competition. Overall, the positive aspects of this news likely outweigh the negatives for Apple.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. (AAPL) partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc. to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones could have mixed effects on Apple's stock price. On one hand, the partnership enhances Apple's satellite communication capabilities, potentially increasing the value proposition of its devices. On the other hand, this move might cannibalize Apple's existing satellite service provided through Globalstar Inc., which saw its shares fall about 11% in premarket trading. Given that Apple's announcement of iOS 18.3 did not disclose the Starlink support and the beta test is minimal, the immediate impact might be neutral. However, the strategic partnership could lead to long-term benefits for Apple, potentially outweighing the risks.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc. to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is a positive development for Apple. This partnership expands Apple's offerings in the satellite communication space, providing an alternative to its in-house service. The fact that the service is designed to work automatically, even when the phone is in a customer's pocket, is a significant advantage over Apple's current Globalstar service. Additionally, the potential for future expansions into data connections and voice calls could further increase the value proposition for Apple customers. However, the impact on Globalstar Inc. is negative, as evidenced by the 11% drop in its shares. Overall, the news is likely to have a positive effect on Apple's stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news indicates a strategic collaboration between Apple and SpaceX to integrate the Starlink satellite network into iPhones. This collaboration broadens Apple's service offerings, potentially enhancing user experience and competitive advantage in connectivity features. While Globalstar shares fell after the news, suggesting market concerns, the positive aspect lies in Apple's expansion into innovative technologies, potentially attracting investor interest and boosting market sentiment. However, there are mixed signals with minimal immediate impact expected.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news of Apple partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into iPhones is generally viewed positively. This partnership provides a competitive edge in satellite communication and expands Apple's service offerings, which could attract more customers. The automatic connection feature of Starlink is a significant improvement over Apple's existing service with Globalstar. While Globalstar’s stock is negatively impacted, indicating market concerns about competition, the long-term strategic advantages for Apple are expected to outweigh the immediate risks. Overall, the combination of innovation, competitive positioning, and consumer interest suggests a higher probability of a stock price rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.63, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.37, Reasoning: The news of Apple integrating Starlink satellite technology into iPhones presents a mixed but overall positive outlook. Several factors contribute to this assessment: 1) Technological Advancement: The partnership with SpaceX expands Apple's connectivity capabilities, offering a unique selling point compared to competitors. The Starlink integration functioning 'automatically, even when the phone is in a customer's pocket,' is a significant advantage. 2) Potential Expansion: Plans to expand Starlink services into data connections and voice calls in the future could further enhance the value proposition for Apple users. 3) Competitive Pressure: The decline in Globalstar shares indicates potential market share loss for Apple's existing partner, which is a concern. 4) Cautious Rollout: The initial beta test's minimal scope and geographical limitations temper the immediate impact. 5) Previous Predictions: Others have had relatively positive sentiment given the news. Balancing these factors and the sentiment of previous predictions, a slightly positive movement in Apple's stock price is anticipated, although tempered by the competitive threat to Globalstar and the limited initial rollout. I will slightly lower the probability of stock price rising comapred to the average of the Round 0 to indicate some negative impact the Globalstar may bring.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.58, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.42, Reasoning: The news of Apple integrating Starlink satellite technology into iPhones is largely positive, representing a significant technological advancement and expansion of Apple's service offerings.  This could enhance Apple's competitive position, particularly given Starlink's automatic connectivity feature, a clear advantage over Apple's current Globalstar service.  However, the negative impact on Globalstar's stock price highlights a potential risk:  cannibalization of Apple's existing satellite service and investor concern about the long-term implications of this partnership. The phased rollout, limited initial functionality (texting only), and geographical restrictions (currently US-only) temper the immediate positive impact.  The consensus from previous predictions leans slightly towards a positive market reaction, but the uncertainty surrounding the long-term implications and potential market share shift suggests a less extreme probability than some previous models indicated. Considering the mixed nature of the news and the already reflected negative sentiment towards Globalstar, a more moderate probability of price rise is assigned.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.68, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.32, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. collaborating with SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into iPhones is generally positive for Apple. This partnership enhances Apple's technological capabilities, offering automatic satellite connectivity, which could be a significant competitive advantage. The potential for future expansions into data and voice services further adds to the positive outlook. While the news negatively impacted Globalstar, Apple's diversification into another satellite service mitigates reliance on a single provider. The immediate impact might be modest due to the limited beta test and US-only availability, but the long-term benefits are substantial. Previous predictions also lean towards a positive sentiment, with probabilities favoring a stock price rise. Considering all factors, the likelihood of Apple's stock price rising is higher than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.62, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc. to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is generally positive, as it expands Apple's satellite communication capabilities and potentially enhances its competitive edge in the market. The partnership introduces a new feature that could attract users, especially in areas with poor cellular coverage. Although Globalstar's stock price fell significantly, indicating potential concerns about competition, the overall sentiment suggests that this move could lead to long-term benefits for Apple. The surprise nature of the announcement and the positive reaction from Elon Musk suggest a potential for increased customer interest and brand enhancement. However, the limited beta test and geographical restrictions temper the immediate impact.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.62, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.38, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile US Inc. to support the Starlink satellite network on iPhones is a positive development for Apple, as it expands the company's satellite communication capabilities and provides an alternative to its in-house service. The fact that the service is designed to work automatically is a significant advantage. However, the impact on Globalstar Inc. is negative, as evidenced by the drop in its shares. Considering the mixed signals from other models' predictions, with some predicting a higher probability of the stock price rising and others a lower one, the overall sentiment seems to be slightly positive but with caution due to the competitive and partnership dynamics involved. Therefore, the estimated probability of the stock price rising is slightly higher than that of falling, reflecting the potential for increased customer interest and brand enhancement through this innovative partnership.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news about Apple's integration of Starlink support into iPhones through a partnership with SpaceX and T-Mobile is generally viewed as positive. This collaboration enhances Apple's connectivity capabilities and offers a competitive edge over existing satellite communication options. The automatic satellite connection feature is a significant improvement compared to Apple's previous service with Globalstar. However, the decline in Globalstar's stock suggests that investors have concerns about market share loss and competition. The current beta testing phase and geographical limitations may temper immediate impacts, but the long-term potential for attracting more customers is promising. Overall, the sentiment is leaning towards optimism, with a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising compared to falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news of Apple partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile on Starlink integration is generally positive for Apple, expanding their satellite communication capabilities and offering a competitive edge with the automatic connectivity feature compared to their existing Globalstar service. The mixed opinions from previous model predictions, with a slight lean towards stock price increase, suggest cautious optimism. However, there's also the concern about potential cannibalization of the current Globalstar partnership, reflected in Globalstar's stock drop, and the limited initial rollout of the Starlink feature impacting user base and immediate revenue generation. Overall, considering the potential long-term benefits and competitive advantages, a stock price rise is more probable, but the negative sentiment surrounding Globalstar and limitations mentioned tempers the probability and bring it closer to 0.6.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.58, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.42, Reasoning: The news of Apple integrating Starlink into iPhones is a complex event with both positive and negative implications.  The positive aspects include: enhanced connectivity options, a competitive advantage over rivals, the potential for future data and voice services, and a partnership with high-profile companies like SpaceX and T-Mobile.  However, the negative aspects include potential cannibalization of Apple's existing Globalstar partnership (evidenced by Globalstar's stock decline), the limited initial rollout (beta test, texting only, US-only), and the overall uncertainty of market reception to this new feature.  The previous predictions show a range of opinions, with a slight bias towards a stock price increase, but not a dramatic one.  Considering the mixed signals and the relatively small initial scale of Starlink integration, I'm assigning a moderate probability to a price increase, reflecting the potential for long-term benefits while acknowledging the immediate uncertainty and potential for negative short-term impact.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news of Apple Inc. partnering with SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into iPhones is a significant development that enhances Apple's competitive edge in satellite communication. This partnership expands Apple's service offerings and introduces a novel feature (automatic satellite connectivity), which could attract more customers and strengthen its ecosystem. While the negative impact on Globalstar's stock price indicates potential concerns about competition, the long-term benefits for Apple, including future expansions into data and voice services, are substantial. Previous predictions largely lean towards a positive sentiment, with probabilities favoring a stock price rise. The limited beta test and geographical restrictions temper the immediate impact, but the overall outlook remains positive. Therefore, the likelihood of Apple's stock price rising is higher than falling.

This partnership enhances Apple's satellite communication capabilities, offering an alternative to its in-house service with Globalstar. The automatic connectivity feature of Starlink is a significant advantage over Apple's current service. While Globalstar's stock price fell significantly, indicating potential concerns about competition, the overall sentiment suggests that this move could lead to long-term benefits for Apple. The surprise nature of the announcement and the positive reaction from Elon Musk suggest a potential for increased customer interest and brand enhancement. However, the limited beta test and geographical restrictions temper the immediate impact. Considering the mixed signals from previous predictions, a slightly positive movement in Apple's stock price is anticipated.

The automatic connectivity feature of Starlink is a significant advantage over Apple's current Globalstar service. However, the negative impact on Globalstar Inc. is a consideration, as evidenced by the drop in its shares. Considering the mixed signals from other models' predictions and weighing the potential for increased customer interest and brand enhancement through this innovative partnership against the competitive and partnership dynamics involved, the overall sentiment seems to be slightly positive but with caution.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The financial news indicates a strategic collaboration between Apple and SpaceX to integrate the Starlink satellite network into iPhones. This collaboration broadens Apple's service offerings, potentially enhancing user experience and competitive advantage in connectivity features. While Globalstar shares fell after the news, suggesting market concerns, the positive aspect lies in Apple's expansion into innovative technologies, potentially attracting investor interest and boosting market sentiment. However, there are mixed signals with minimal immediate impact expected.
